content.description: A block of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides along a horizontal surface where friction between the block and the surface is negligible. The block initial has kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math>. The block collides with and sticks to a second block of mass <math alttext="3 times m" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></math> that is initially at rest.
content.question: What is the kinetic energy of the two-block system after the collision?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
